repnme.cdata!:
Nigeria - First National Urban Water Sector
            Reform Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the First National Urban
            Water Sector Reform Project for Nigeria were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory, risk to development
            outcome was substantial, Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: projects
            involving the introduction of significant reforms to improve
            sector outcomes based on global good practice should set
            realistic timeframes and targets based on candid assessment
            of the local context, including the political economy,
            market risks, and the sectors ability to hedge them, and
            sector readiness for changes, as well as recognition of the
            fact that reform is a long-term process that requires the
            engagement, commitment, and support of all key stakeholders.
            Project design should also include incentives to make
            Borrowers more accountable for achieving results on all
            critical activities, including reforms required to ensure
            achievement of development outcomes. The design of project
            implementation arrangements that are decentralized to the
            sub-national level such as state level should ensure that
            adequate checks and controls are included and enforced in
            supervision arrangements, especially where capacity is an
            issue. The design of project implementation arrangements
            should ensure that staffing policies include incentives that
            promote the retention of experienced staff seconded by
            government or externally sourced who have benefitted from
            capacity building opportunities provided through the
            project. The use of an independent technical auditor on an
            annual or bi-annual basis will enhance the integrity and
            reliability of the project monitoring data. Assessment of
            project implementation readiness should not only focus on
            having a procurement plan for the first year of
            implementation, but also pay adequate attention to
            completing critical preparatory activities such as detailed
            designs for investments, to allow for timely commencement,
            and implementation of activities once the loan or credit
            becomes effective.

repnme.cdata!:
Nigeria - Building macroeconomic stability
            and delivering services for the poor

abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about
            building macroeconomic stability and delivering services for
            the poor in Nigeria. Despite Nigeria’s strong economic track
            record, poverty is significant, and reducing it would
            require strong non-oil growth and a focus on human
            development. National Urban Water Sector Reform Project
            addressed the fundamental causes of the problem, and ensured
            improved governance at all levels. As a result, projects in
            various sectors had seen positive results in education,
            health, and the delivery of clean water in the country.
